meanings.definition: Commanding respect because of great age or impressive dignity.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tree in the park exuded a sense of venerability.
meanings.sent2: The wise elder was revered for his venerability in the community.
meanings.sent3: The old library books whispered tales of venerability to the curious readers.
meanings.sent4: The historic castle stood as a symbol of venerability in the town.
meanings.sent5: The wrinkled face of the elderly man showed the venerability of his years.

meanings.sent1: The sacred relic possessed a certain venerability that drew pilgrims from afar.
meanings.sent2: The ancient artifact had an aura of venerability that intrigued historians.
meanings.sent3: The old statue seemed to wink mischievously, mocking its own venerability.
meanings.sent4: The revered leader's speech carried a sense of venerability that inspired the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The historic site was filled with an air of venerability that left visitors in awe.
